result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Gregory Dowl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine PLUS costs by July 27, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment.

**Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Gregory Dowl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant pay $100.00 fine PLUS costs by July 27, 2016 or entry of a civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Brian Gregory Dowl in court with attorney Adam c Essling. Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Brian Gregory Dowl in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted.  Court ordered case adjourned for speedy projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. For reasons stated on the record, Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Calendar call scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Gregory Dowl in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brian Gregory Dowl in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Brian Gregory Dowl in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
